frameDefinitions: The action of an Agent or the occurrence of a Cause event returns an Entity to an earlier  state of vigor and strength.
In this frame, an Agent or Cause changes the timing of an Event.
An Agent or Cause causes an Entity to change, either in its category membership or in terms of the value of an Attribute.
An Agent alters some Material in some useful way by means of some chemical or physical Alterant.
This frame describes assembly or construction actions, where an Agent joins Components together to form a Created_entity, which is profiled, and hence the object of the verb.
An Agent acts so as to cause some process to begin again after an interruption or suspension.
frameExamples: Falling prices and wireless connectivity have <t>breathed new life</t> into the PDA market.
Our storylines follows the saga outlined by the Ultima Series, but we have <t>modified</t> it in order to make our writing more cohesive.
Native Americans <t>dyed</t> textiles with dyes made from cedar strips.
Jack <t>built</t> a new house out of bricks.
The two countries <t>revived</t> diplomatic relations after a lull of five years.
listRoleDefinitions: The concrete or abstract thing that is brought into an earlier state in which it was more effective and powerful.
The <fen>Agent</fen> puts the <fen>Entity</fen> into a state of renewed vigor.
An event or state whose occurrence brings about the <fen>Entity</fen>'s return to a vigorous state.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the renewal of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the Agent brings about the change in the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the animate entity which brings about the change in time of the <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient force which brings about the change of time for the <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occurrence which changes time.
The time at which the delay occurred.
The location at which the expected time of the <fen>Event</fen> changes.
The sentient entity that effects a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The category of which the <fen>Entity</fen> is a member before the <fen>Agent</fen> causes a change.
The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to after it has undergone the change.
The value that the <fen>Attribute</fen> assumes as a result of the change that the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused to undergo.
The value that the <fen>Attribute</fen> has before the change takes place.
A characteristic of the <fen>Entity</fen> for which a value can be assigned or determined by calculation, measurement , or observation.
The abstract or concrete thing or situation that the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to change.
An event that causes a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which the change of the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused.
The location where the change of the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is a person who applies the Process to the Material.
The <fen>Alterant</fen> causes a change in the <fen>Material</fen>.
The <fen>Material</fen> is altered by the <fen>Agent</fen> in some useful way.
The point in time or period during which the treatment of the <fen>Material</fen> takes place.
The location in which the <fen>Material</fen>s are processed, often a purpose-built facility such as a tannery or water treatment plant.
The <fen>Agent</fen> builds a <fen>Created_entity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Components</fen> that form the <fen>Created_entity</fen>.
<fen>Created_entity</fen> identifies the entity that is created in the act of building.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the building occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the building occurs.
A sentient being acts with the intention of causing a process to begin again.
The process which begins again after a suspension.
The period of time during which the process is suspended.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that causes the process to resume. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of Causes.
The time at which the process is restarted.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Process</fen> to resume.
listRoleExamples: The reinvigoration <fex>of the tourism</fex> economy is recognised by many as an ambitious but necessary objective.
<fex>We</fex> revitalized the Golden Mountaineer Card, and we gave seniors a prescription drug benefit.
Rock has been rejuvenated creatively and commercially <fex>by hip-hop-inspired rock acts</fex>.
Production was revitalized <fex>last June</fex>.

New York's distinction as America's tax cut leader has revitalized the economy
<fex>in every corner of the state</fex>.
<fex>The umpire</fex> postponed the game.
<fex>The rain</fex> delayed the baseball game.
<fex>The opening of the musical</fex> was delayed.
<fex>The system administrator</fex> changed the value from 'KDE' to 'GNOME', and then restarted the system.
Her time with the Healer Craft has changed her <fex>from a shy, nervous young girl</fex> into a confident (almost) young woman
The radical message of the cross transformed Saul of Tarsus and changed him from a persecutor of Christians <fex>to a tender believer</fex>.
We changed the size from 8 1/2x11 <fex>to a larger 11 x 17</fex> and gave it a complete graphical makeover.
My dad changed his hair color <fex>from red</fex>  to blue today.
We changed <fex>the price</fex> from $1.26 to $1.27 per pint.
The recent terrorist attacks had changed <fex>the political climate</fex>.
<fex>Major technological innovations</fex> changed the social and economic conditions.
He changed it <fex>after David Bowie told him that only twerps have the same first and last name</fex>.
<fex>In his own room</fex> he had modified nothing.
Stu treated <fex>the lumber</fex> with magical waterproofing fairydust.
<fex>Jack</fex> built a new house.
Jack built  a new house <fex>out of old bricks</fex>.
Jack built <fex>a new house</fex>.
Jack built a new house <fex>early in the morning</fex>.
Jack built a new house <fex>in a glade</fex>.
<fex>The driver</fex> restarted the truck after it stalled.
The two countries revived diplomatic relations <fex>after a lull of five years</fex>.
<fex>The spring rains</fex> restarted the flow of the stream.
This state reinstated the death penalty <fex>in 1975</fex>.
The two nations revived relations <fex>in Geneva</fex> during the latest round of talks.
